dialogue.String: 1�What is this?You wish to know of the Multinational Expedition and its search for the Gate of the Gods?
1�How do you answer?Yes.No.
1�I see.Ulmia, too, wished to learn more of the Gate of the Gods, so I recommended that she attend the upcoming sermon on the subject.
1�Yes, by all means you may attend as well. My sermon will begin momentarily.
1�Eschew all desire and embrace Altana. Only then will she bless you in her glory.
1�That is all for today's sermon. May Paradise open its gates to you.
1�Of course, my child. What is it you wish to know?
1�When I was young, I often heard the stories of Paradise.
1�A legendary land where the gods slumber...A gate leading to that land, discovered by the ancients...
1�However, according to the stories I heard, the ancients angered the Twilight God by attempting to open the forbidden gate. As punishment, he cast a terrible curse upon them all...
1�If this hideous tale is true, then why is the San d'Orian Cathedral attempting to convince people that we should open the gates...?
1�Or has the cathedral discovered a method to soothe the wrath of the gods?
1�...I must assume that you are not of our kingdom.
1�Our church, too, teaches of the Gates of the Gods--the Gates of Paradise. However, we are told it is a line that the children of Vana'diel have been forbidden to cross.
1�The exact opposite of what the San d'Orian Cathedral teaches...
1�I apologize, but I must prepare for my next sermon.If you wish to learn more, inquire with one of the high priests.
1�It is the lifework of our missionaries to enlighten. May they lead you in the direction of truth...
1�Welcome, travelers. Even after listening to the vicasque's sermon, you still have questions regarding Paradise?
1�The Dawn Goddess watched over him and his work, and blessed him with her glory.
1�However, that is not all she gave him. Before his passing, Altana showed the papsque the path to Paradise.
1�The path to Paradise...?
1�Yes. His final words told us that to obtain Paradise, one must eschew all desire and embrace the Dawn Goddess.
1�For many years, we believed that the path to Paradise and gates guarding it were things that actually existed on Vana'diel.
1�The cathedral scoured through the ancient tomes and documents in our vaults, went to war with other nations...
1�I have heard that San d'Oria even attacked the Tavnazian Cathedral... All this to find a Paradise that was only meant to exist in our hearts...
1�Instilling fear to find a land where mankind could live without fear. This paradox ultimately put distance between us and Altana.
1�But thanks to the teachings of Muchavatte, we have realized the error of our ways and thus made it our mission to enlighten our brothers and sisters regarding the true path to Paradise.
1�Do you understand?
1�That is...
1�Of all things, you should know this well, child of Tavnazia.
1�Travelers, you need not worry.
1�It is our duty to serve Altana and introduce her blessed light to the unfortunate masses.
1�If we follow the teachings of the Dawn Goddess and do not stray from the path of righteousness, the chains of evil will be broken and the Gates of Paradise will open.
1�Yes... I see now...Thank you very much for your kindness in explaining this all to us.
1�No, you need not thank me. I am simply pleased to know that you now understand the truth behind Paradise.
1�You said that you seek the Royal Knight Francmage M Mistalle, did you not?
1�If I am not mistaken, I recall a section of Jugner Forest known as Carpenters' Landing being owned by the Knights Mistalle.
1�I do not believe you will be able to reach the manor, but you may find some of his hands by the water collecting firewood.

1�Trial: Defeat a set number of  [experience-yielding monsters/monsters] under the prescribed conditions.
1�Eschew all desire and embrace Altana. Only then will she bless you in her glory.
1�I am grateful to have been given the opportunity to hear your sermon.
1�However, there are still many things I do not understand. Would you be so kind as to spare a few moments to answer my questions?
1�When I was young, I often heard the stories of Paradise.
1�If this hideous tale is true, then why is the San d'Orian Cathedral attempting to convince people that we should open the gates...?
1�Or has the cathedral discovered a method to soothe the wrath of the gods?
1�Our church, too, teaches of the Gates of the Gods--the Gates of Paradise. However, we are told it is a line that the children of Vana'diel have been forbidden to cross.
1�The exact opposite of what the San d'Orian Cathedral teaches...
1�For the past twenty years, we have searched tirelessly for an entrance to Paradise.
1�Do you accept the mission?I accept.Could you explain again?No, thank you.
1�Welcome, travelers. Even after listening to the vicasque's sermon, you still have questions regarding Paradise?
1�Very well. Please, step this way and I will try to quench your thirst for knowledge.

1�But our opinion is of no matter. Lightbringer will decide who is the most suited to stand over our fine nation. And do not speak a word of today's exchange, for the monarlais will have our heads if he finds out.
1�During his papacy, the papsque devoted himself to healing the wounds in the hearts of man--wounds left by the flames of war.
1�The Dawn Goddess watched over him and his work, and blessed him with her glory.
1�However, that is not all she gave him. Before his passing, Altana showed the papsque the path to Paradise.
1�Yes. His final words told us that to obtain Paradise, one must eschew all desire and embrace the Dawn Goddess.
1�For many years, we believed that the path to Paradise and gates guarding it were things that actually existed on Vana'diel.
1�Instilling fear to find a land where mankind could live without fear. This paradox ultimately put distance between us and Altana.
1�But thanks to the teachings of Muchavatte, we have realized the error of our ways and thus made it our mission to enlighten our brothers and sisters regarding the true path to Paradise.
1�In order to become a true adventurer, and bear 6����, you must be recognized by Bastok and Windurst as well.
1�Do you understand?
1�Yes, I believe I do.
1�However, I have one last question. How are we to break free from the curse of the Twilight God?
1�That is...
1�It is forbidden to speak of the abhorrent one.
1�Of all things, you should know this well, child of Tavnazia.
1�Travelers, you need not worry.
1�It is our duty to serve Altana and introduce her blessed light to the unfortunate masses.

1�No, you need not thank me. I am simply pleased to know that you now understand the truth behind Paradise.
1�You said that you seek the Royal Knight Francmage M Mistalle, did you not?
1�So this is the San d'Orian Cathedral...Together with the Tavnazian Cathedral, they form the pillars of our faith.
1�If anyone is truly attempting to open the Gates of Paradise, I am certain it is someone in there...
1�What? I don't want this!

1�You seem lost, recruit. Tell me if there's anything you wish to know.
1�Something you'd like to know?Nothing in particular.I want to go out and fight!I want to go shopping.I want to know more about adventuring.
1�Just arrived and you're already aching to leave, eh? Listen, the land is wild beyond our gates, filled with fiends and their ilk.
1�If you must go outside, head through Ranperre Gate. Allow me to explain.
1�Right now we're on the Parade Grounds. Find the gate to the west.
1�For weapons and basic supplies, take a walk through the city and you'll find all that you need.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Recruits... Don't know which way to hold a sword and you think you're ready. Well, what would you like to know?
1�What would you like to know about?Helping people.Hunting monsters.Making easy money.Working for my country.
1�Ah, a commendable choice! I saw a lady in front of a house on Pikeman's Way who may be in need of assistance.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Prince Pieuje,   retrieved this stone tablet from deep within the oubliette.
1�Vicasque Arnau, I've come to talk to you about the missing acolyte. It seems his disappearance may not have been the Orcs' doing after all.
1�You speak the truth, Your Holiness. The citadel cannot be emptied of Temple Knights for so uncertain a cause.
1�No, of course not. I have decided to send an adventurer. If �[he/she] finds that Orcs do hold the boy, then the Temple Knights will be there to claim him.
1�By the way, who have you been talking with?
1�Well, that's perfect. I shall order you to undertake this mission.
1�Infiltrate Ghelsba, and determine whether they hold this Tedimout captive. I've heard they keep prisoners in a small hut somewhere.
1�Once you know, notify a Temple Knight. Now, go!
1�We can negotiate with the Orcs once we know what they want, but I loathe the prospect of sending Temple Knights to scout.
1�I understand. We must first find what the Orcs know of Paradise's gates.
1�Hm? Is someone there?
1�No, it is all right, Your Holiness.
1�So... The Orcs are searching for something. What it is we cannot say. This requires further delving.
1�Thank you,  . I will inform the gatehouse knight that your mission is complete.
1�A receipt, eh? I can't read this fancy writing. Who's it for? Prince Trion, or Prince Pieuje?
1�Who is it for?Prince Trion.Prince Pieuje.
1�All right, I'll deliver it for you. We can't let you in looking like that! Wait here.
1�I delivered the 3���� to Prince Trion. You're dismissed.
1�Imbecile! That envelope was for Prince Pieuje, not Prince Trion! Such idiocy... Get out of here!
1�All right, I'll deliver it for you. We can't let you in looking like that! Wait here.
1�I delivered the 3���� to Prince Pieuje. You're dismissed.
1�Imbecile! That envelope was for Prince Trion, not Prince Pieuje! Such idiocy... Get out of here!
1�Oh, and tell that shopkeeper to send someone respectable next time!
1�Yes? Is there something you need?
1�Do you have a question?Not really.About your father...About your grandfather...
1�Father? He said he had business at the weaponseller's in the southern part of town.Are you an acquaintance of his?
1�He's so engrossed in his blades that he's not given me a swordfighting lesson in weeks!At this rate, I shall never become a knight...
1�I am loath to boast, but his knowledge of armor and weaponry is second to none in the Kingdom.Helbort often consults with him about rare orders.
1�You've heard of Grandfather? That does not surprise me.He was, after all, an angler of no small repute.

1�Why, in his younger days, he would rise at the crack of dawn, and hike through Jugner Forest to Lake Mechieume.There, he would lose himself in fishing until sunset. Remarkable devotion, is it not?
1�Oh, would that I could go on such a fishing trip with my own father!Alas, it seems he did not inherit Grandfather's love for the sport...
1�Oh, where could he be?
1�I-I came here with my father, and now he's g-gone!
1�My father is a knight! Today he's on holiday, and so we went out for a walk. B-but now...
1�M-my father is so proud of his knighthood, he's still in uniform today. He looks noble indeed, though his armor creaks with each step!
1�He's not wearing his helmet, though... We came through Victory Arch together but, but now...
1�What? Y-you found my father?
1�Ailbeche?
1�Fathe
r?�Why, you milksop! Lose sight of your father and all you do is wail for the nearest stranger? Have you no shame?
1�B-but, Father...
1�Enough! You are Elvaan! I expect more from you! Understand?
1�B-but, Father! No...
1�I'll forge you into shape yet! Now, stand there till you get a hold of yourself!
1�F-Father... How could you!
e!�Let me apologize for my son. Please accept this in return for your time.
1�No! Th-that's my fishing rod... Father!
1�Quiet! I will not have my own son cry like a baby!
1�No, Father! Don't leave m
1�Thank you for the fishing rod! By the way, there is something else I wish to ask of you.
1�I need 6���� from Ordelle's Caves. I must have it in order to sharpen a certain sword.
1�Would you please do me this favor?
1�I need 6���� from Ordelle's Caves. I must have it in order to sharpen a certain sword.
1�What do you say?I'll do my best.I can't right now.
1�Wonderful! I wish I could tell you where it could be found. Try asking someone who often sharpens blades.
1�That is all right. I have troubled you enough. Perhaps I will ask someone else.
1�I wish I could tell you where 6���� is inside the caves. Try asking someone who often sharpens blades.
1�Thank you. Here, this is for you. I snatched it from my father's chest. He won't notice if one goes missing. And besides, I'll be sharpening this blade for him!
1�Oh, how I wish that Father was more like Vilbert. He wouldn't give one up, even if I asked.
1�Oh, I knew he would say no. Long ago, Father was not like this.
1�You see, my mother was killed by Orcs. My father was there, but he couldn't save her.
1�He blamed her death on the quality of his armor and weapons. He gave up practicing swordsmanship every morning, and spends all his time scouring the shops for equipment.
1�He is needed in the expeditions, but always he declines due to a supposed sickness or insufficiencies in equipment. I fear he will lose his rank as captain.
1�I am sure a knight of my father's stature could soon get me  $����. How can I go fishing now?
1�Oh, %���� can only be found in the Crawlers' Nest. And such a quest is beyond me! I wonder how I could get one...
1�What? You caught the big one? Amazing! I doubt I could have done the same.
1�Now, hurry and get it cleaned! I have heard of an expert fisherman in Selbina. You should find him and ask him!
1�Wow! Such a thing was inside its gizzard? Surely I would never have caught him, for he gave even you a run for your money.
1�Father, how could you forget this sword?
1�What? Vilbert is in league with the Orcs? Hah! What nonsense!
1�I will not fall for such a joke so easily. Vilbert is taking me fishing in Jugner Forest. Be not surprised if I catch a bigger fish than the big one!
1�You saw, did you not? My father is a mighty knight! I wish to become like him!
1�Father promised to take me fishing! But I know that he is a much greater swordsman than a fisher.
1�Now I shall prepare the #���� that you gave me.
1�Can I interest you in some magical maps?
1�When you look at a map for your present area, you can see the lay of the land, as well as your current location.
1�Members of your party and alliance will appear on the map, too. Also, certain jobs let you find people and monsters from a distance.
1�They're especially handy because you can mark where you've been, and some people can mark them for you as well.
1�You haven't enough money, �[sir/ma'am].

1�Weary traveler, come pray with us.
1�Here in the San d'Oria Cathedral, we devote our lives to helping people reach the shining gates of Paradise.
1�Should you wish to know more about Paradise, come to the vicasque's sermon. Much will be revealed.
1�Should you wish to hear the sermon, please prepare an offering of  $���� as proof of your faith.

1�May Paradise open its gates to you.

1�Before the Great War, when the former papsque, Muchavatte P Couchiret, was still with us...
1�During his time, we believed that the Gates of Paradise were hidden somewhere within the reach of mortal man.
1�The Royal Knight you search for, Francmage M Mistalle, joined the Multinational Expedition thirty years ago to search for the truth behind that belief. And it is because of that very search...
1�It is the lifework of our missionaries to enlighten. May they lead you in the direction of truth...

1�Currently, the cathedral is conducting preparations for the Rites of Succession. If it were not for the outbreak at the coming-of-age ceremony, the services of the Temple Knights would not have been necessary...
1�The responsibility of conducting such an important event has taken its toll on all of us here. Even His Holiness has been on edge as of late.
1�Was it our lack of faith that brought this time of despair upon us?
1�The papsque is currently being held at the Chateau d'Oraguille for questioning on the matters at hand. I have never seen His Holiness so disturbed...
1�Other than those who attended, none know of what took place at the Rites of Succession. However, I must be strong, as not to bring worry upon the members of our faith.

1�The papsque has returned from Chateau d'Oraguille and will now pay penitence for his sins.He will be allowed to perform his normal duties, however, a Temple Knight escort will accompany him when leaving the cathedral.
1�Perhaps the time to reconsider the role of the Gates to Paradise is upon us. May the knowledge of the papsque's sins guide us to a better path.
1�I shall begin shortly. Should you have questions, kindly beseech the friar at the narthex.
1�Oh, an adventurer. If you are here for the sermon on the Gates of Paradise, beseech the friar standing at the narthex.
1�You say you came on behalf of the Temple Knights? And you want to know about Tedimout?
1�Why, may Altana bless thee! Yes, Tedimout was a friar in training.
1�Oft would he enter the woods of Ronfaure, in search of wild herbs for the making of tea and medicines.
1�Ever did I warn him against going alone, for the trees can hide predators...and worse!
1�He claimed that the blue robes of the clergy would protect him.
1�But it seems his faith was ill-placed. I fear that Orcs took him!
1�The horror he must be facing now... Each morning and night I pray to the Goddess of the Dawn to deliver him from their clutches!
1�Why, Prince Pieuje! And, Papsque Shamonde!
1�I understand, of course. However... If it were true that Tedimout did happen to be kidnapped by Orcs, surely we could not simply let him die?
1�I understand, Your Highness. I am very thankful.
1�Your Highness,   is here on errand from the knight at the gatehouse. �[He/She] came to ask about Tedimout.
1�You have my eternal thanks for saving Tedimout!
1�All I can do is pray for adventurers. Please, let me pray for you, too.
1�May light shine upon thy path, and may the Gates of Paradise open to you!
1�Believers, today's sermon will now begin.
1�Kindly reflect upon his words in silence.
1�My children, welcome. Today I would like to speak about Paradise.
1�In this world, we are born to wither and die. Every mortal is bound by these chains.
1�Only the chosen may pass through the gates of Paradise, to live forever under Altana, free from fear and decay.
1�Here in the San d'Oria Cathedral, we devote each day to helping believers along the blessed path.
1�Though the road to Paradise is fraught with peril, there is no other way to life everlasting.
1�Altana has guided us here today. Toward the gates of Paradise we walk together, one step at a time.
1�My children, as you prepare to take your first step, remember that naught is as important as the spirit of giving.
1�Providence shall come with the renunciation of greed. The one treasure we may keep is generosity!
1�Now, I recall a friar on retreat in East Ronfaure.
1�He spends his days fasting in prayer, pausing only to eat blue peas.
1�In reverence of his devotion, let us deliver him sustenance!
1�Beseech Friar Abioleget at the narthex, so that he might entrust the peas to you.

1�Venture roll is a competitive game played with dice similar to those used by corsairs. The objective is to roll until your cumulative total comes as close to 11 as possible without going over.

1�Until you reach or go over 11, you may continue rolling (doubling up) as many times as the table time limit allows (
  � [minute/minutes], Earth time).
1�In addition to doubling up, you may also decline to roll the dice and stay with your current total (hold fast).
1�If your total ever goes over 11, you will automatically lose the game, regardless of the totals of other players. Knowing the right time to hold fast is one of the keys to staying in the match.

1�Once all the players have held fast, the game is over and the results are announced. The player closest to 11 is declared the winner and receives all the gil in the pot (the original participation fees of all the players).
1�Objective: Roll a six-sided die as many times as necessary to achieve a total as close to 11 as possible. You lose the instant your total exceeds 11.
1�If two or more players are the closest to 11 at the end of a match, the game is considered a draw and all participation fees are repaid in full.
1�Once the game has started, fees will not be refunded for any reason unless the match results in a draw.

1�The Assist Channel is a special chat channel that allows adventurers to ask questions and receive advice from veteran players known as mentors.
1�Press the space bar to bring up the text window at the bottom of the screen and type ��/assistj (your message)�� or ��/assiste (your message)�� to post your message.
1�You can also use ��/aj�� for ��/assistj��, and ��/ae�� for ��/assiste��.
1�Additionally, pressing CTRL+Q will display ��/assistj�� or ��/assiste�� in the text window for you.
1�You can change the CTRL+Q shortcut command...
1�...by going to Main Menu > Config > Misc. 2 > Key Assignment > Commands > Chat: /AssistE or /AssistJ.
1�It is recommended that you use ��/assistj (/aj)�� when posting in Japanese, and ��/assiste (/ae)�� when posting in English.
1�You must meet one of the following conditions in order to post to the Assist Channel.
1�1. You are a new playerYou may post messages from the moment you first set foot in Vana'diel.
1�2. You are a returneeAs a returning player, you may post messages upon logging in with a character that has not logged in for at least 48 days.
1�3. You are a mentorYou may post messages as long as you remain a mentor to other players.
1�New players and returnees may post messages until they have been logged in for a total of 48 hours since first receiving their posting rights.
1�If you wish to check how long you can continue to post for, speak to an 	 and choose "When do my posting rights expire?" to see how much time you have left.
1�The Assist Channel can only be used in the following areas.
1�...7����, 7����,7�ƀ�, and your Mog House (Rent-a-Room).
1�You cannot post or read messages outside of the areas listed above.
1�Even in areas where messages are allowed, you cannot post consecutive messages.Please wait a while after posting a message.
1�Mentor messages are accompanied by a flag (�/) marker.This marker indicates the mentor's reliability (Mentor Class) and experience as an adventurer (Mastery Rank).
1�As a mentor's Mentor Class increases, the color and shape of the marker will change: �/ > �9 > �C
1�A �C marker is a sign that the mentor has earned the highest levels of trust from other adventurers.
1�The number affixed to the marker is the mentor's Mastery Rank, and indicates how experienced the mentor is as an adventurer.
1�The higher the number, the more experienced the mentor is.
1�You can check your own Mastery Rank even if you do not serve as a mentor, so feel free to take a look every now and then if you are curious.
1�You can check your Mastery Rank by going to Main Menu > Status > Profile.
1�If you wish to speak directly to a mentor, you can search for mentors by going to Main Menu > Help Desk > Mentor Search.
1�The ��Thumbs Up�� feature enables you to let mentors know when their comments proved to be especially helpful.
1�Mentors who earn lots of ��Thumbs Up�� replies from other adventurers will see their Mentor Class increase.
1�Remember to give a ��Thumbs Up�� to any mentor you feel helped you out or taught you something useful.
1�A ��Warning�� is a feature that can only be used by mentors.
1�Please use this feature when a post's contents are insufficient or otherwise may be construed as harassment.

1�To send a ��Thumbs Up�� or ��Warning�� to another player, open the Chat Log Window and move the cursor over the relevant message and press the confirm button (Enter key) to bring up the evaluation menu.
1�Evaluations can be made for 10 minutes following the designated player's latest post to the Assist Channel.
1�You may send up to one ��Thumbs Up�� and one ��Warning�� per day (Earth time).
1�The ��Mute�� feature places restrictions on your ability to post, meaning that other players will be unable to see the messages you post to the Assist Channel.
1�Please refrain from posting unsuitable content so that the veteran adventurers are not forced to mute you.
1�Mute status can be removed by players that have the necessary Mute List access rights, or it will be removed automatically 24 hours (Earth time) after the mute status was enabled.
